troubleshooting.title: What to do if you're in the dark

condition.p: The light has worked until now, when all of a sudden the light goes out.

cause.title: The lightbulb has burnt out
cause.p: Lightbulbs are typically made out of a tungsten filament. Overtime, this filament can wear down with the heat that creates the light, and can burn out. You can tell the lightbulb has burnt out by removing the lighbulb from the light fixture, and either shaking it to listen for the broken filament, or examining it for a dark spot on the glass.

step.cmd: Remove the possibly burnt out bulb from the light fixture.
Examine the bulb to ensure that it is burnt out before throwing it away.
Screw in a new bulb into the light fixture.

cause.title: The lightbulb is not tight enough
cause.p: Lightbulbs work by passing an electrical current through a tungsten filament. In order for the electrical current to reach the inside of the lightbulb, the base of the lightbulb contains an electrical foot contact that recives the electrical current from the light fixture. If the base of the lightbulb is not touching the light fixture's end, the current can't pass through.

step.cmd: With the light switch off, tighten the lightbulb.
